createdAt.description: The date at which the report was created in ISO 8601 date time format.

endDate.description: The end date for the reporting period in YYYY-mm-dd format.

failureReason.description: Present for failed reports only. The reason why a report failed to generate.

fileSize.description: The size of the report file, in bytes.

generatedAt.description: The date at which the report was generated in ISO 8601 date time format.

name.description: Optional. The name of the generated report.

reportId.description: The identifier of the requested report.

startDate.description: The start date for the reporting period in YYYY-mm-dd format.

status.description:
The build status of the report.
  - `PENDING` - Report is created and awaiting processing.
  - `PROCESSING` - Report is processing. Please wait.
  - `COMPLETED` - Report has completed.

updatedAt.description: The date at which the report was last updated in ISO 8601 date time format.

urlExpiresAt.description: The date at which the download URL for the generated report expires. urlExpires at this time defaults to 3600 seconds but may vary in the future.

columns.description:
The list of columns to be used for report. The availability of
columns depends on the selection of reportTypeId. This list cannot be null or empty.

filters.description: The list of filters supported by a report type. The availability of filters fields depends on the selection of reportTypeId.

groupBy.description:
This field determines the aggregation level of the report data and also makes additional fields available
for selection. This field cannot be null or empty.

reportTypeId.description: The identifier of the Report Type to be generated.

timeUnit.description:
The aggregation level of report data. If the timeUnit is set to `SUMMARY`, the report data is aggregated at the time period specified. The availability
of time unit breakdowns depends on the selection of reportTypeId.

field.description: The field name of the filter

values.description: The values to be filtered by

code.description: The HTTP status code of the response.

detail.description: A human-readable description of the response.

endDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD format. The maximum lookback window supported depends on the selection of reportTypeId. Most report types support `95 days` as lookback window.

startDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD format. The maximum lookback window supported depends on the selection of reportTypeId. Most report types support `95 days` as lookback window.

code.description: The HTTP status code of the response.

detail.description: A human-readable description of the response.

post.description: Creates a report request. Use this operation to request the creation of a new report for Amazon Advertising Products. Use `adProduct` to specify the Advertising Product of the report.

parameters.description: The client identifier of the customer making the request.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

parameters.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use GET method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

parameters.description: The identifier of a DSP advertiser account. Optional. For details, see [this guide](guides/reporting/dsp/creating-reports).
parameters.name: Amazon-Ads-AccountId

401.description: Unauthorized - Request failed because user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

422.description: Unprocessable entity - Failed due to invalid parameters.

425.description: Too Early - Request is a duplicate of a processing request.

429.description: Too Many Requests - Request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: Internal Server Error - Something went wrong on the server. Retry later and report an error if unresolved.

delete.description:
Deletes a report by id. Use this operation to cancel a report in a `PENDING` status.

**Authorized resource type**:
Global Ad Account ID, Profile ID

**Parameter name**:
Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope...

parameters.description: The identifier of the requested report.
parameters.name: reportId

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

parameters.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use GET method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

parameters.description: The identifier of a DSP advertiser account. Optional. For details, see [this guide](guides/reporting/dsp/creating-reports).
parameters.name: Amazon-Ads-AccountId

401.description: Unauthorized - Request failed because user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

429.description: Too Many Requests - Request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: Internal Server Error - Something went wrong on the server. Retry later and report an error if unresolved.

get.description:
Gets a generation status of a report by id. Uses the `reportId` value from
the response of previously requested report via `POST /reporting/reports`
operation.

parameters.description: The identifier of the requested report.
parameters.name: reportId

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

parameters.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use GET method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

parameters.description: The identifier of a DSP advertiser account. Optional. For details, see [this guide](guides/reporting/dsp/creating-reports).
parameters.name: Amazon-Ads-AccountId

401.description: Unauthorized - Request failed because user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

429.description: Too Many Requests - Request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: Internal Server Error - Something went wrong on the server. Retry later and report an error if unresolved.

get.summary: Gets a generation status of report by id
